intro: Asterocephalus columbaria var. degenerans, commonly known as the degenerate starhead, is a rare and unusual plant species characterized by its distinctive, star-like inflorescence. It is native to specific regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, pale yellow to white flowers that are clustered in a radiating pattern, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
